intro: Erythraea latifolia var. tenuiflora, commonly known as the narrow-flowered broadleaf erythraea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
